definition[0]: the act or process of making a book, magazine etc using a machine that puts ink onto paper
definition[1]: an act of printing a number of copies of a book
example[3]: The first printing of her book was 10,000 copies.
definition[2]: a method of writing when you write each letter separately rather than joining the letters of a word
definition[3]: the work of producing books, newspapers etc on a machine that puts words, numbers, pictures etc onto the surface of paper
example[4]: Thomson is a printing and publishing concern.
example[5]: The firm has access to printing and typesetting facilities throughout the UK.
definition[4]: the act of printing a number of copies of a book
example[6]: The book is already in its fourth printing (=it has been printed four times).
